bug.short_desc: Tree View "jumps back" When Navigating Tree Structure

long_desc.thetext: When you load the Apiviewer, the top-most item in the navigation tree structure is selected ("qx"). When you now expand subtrees and scroll down along (e.g. to open ui -> virtual -> cell), *without* actually selecting one of the tree items, just operating the [+] icons in front of the folders, the scroll position always jumps back to the top after each click. This is irritating as you lose the scroll position you were looking at.
Just tried it in the devel version and could not reproduce the issue. Is it browser dependent?

(In reply to comment #1) > Just tried it in the devel version and could not reproduce the issue. Is it > browser dependent?
Sorry, I was referring to the wrong application: s/Apiviewer/Testrunner/g. I can reproduce it in Opera 11.6, Chrome 18 and Firefox 13.
Seems like a regression we introduced with qooxdoo 1.6. Might be an issue of the virtual tree.
Can't reproduce in Chrome 29, Firefox 24 or Opera 12.16 on Linux. Thomas, could you please check if this is still an issue on your system?
